importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The game took place on Thursday, October 17, 2025, highlighting a significant matchup between two veteran quarterbacks in a high-profile NFL contest.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The game was played on a Thursday night, part of the NFL's Thursday Night Football schedule, emphasizing the ongoing relevance of veteran players in modern football.

keyTakeAways: Joe Flacco and Aaron Rodgers, two of the NFL's oldest active quarterbacks, delivered standout performances in a high-scoring game dubbed the 'Icy Hot Bowl'.
Joe Flacco led the Cincinnati Bengals to a 33-31 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers, marking his first win in Cincinnati after being traded from the Cleveland Browns.
Flacco threw for 342 yards and three touchdowns, including key plays in the final minutes that secured the win.
The Bengals mounted a dramatic 20-point comeback after Pittsburgh led 10-0 midway through the second quarter.
Aaron Rodgers, 41 years old, threw for 64,222 yards and moved into fifth place on the NFL all-time career passing yards list, passing Ben Roethlisberger.
Both quarterbacks showed that veteran experience and skill remain valuable in the NFL, even as the league is often seen as a young man’s game.
The game highlighted the resilience of veteran players and the importance of depth and experience in high-pressure situations.

namedEntities.name: Joe Flacco
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former quarterback, currently playing for the Cincinnati Bengals
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Flacco is a key player in the article as the veteran quarterback who outperformed Aaron Rodgers in a crucial game, securing a win for the Bengals and showing continued elite performance at age 40.

namedEntities.name: Aaron Rodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Veteran quarterback, playing for the Pittsburgh Steelers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rodgers is central to the article as a veteran competitor who matched Flacco in intensity and production, achieving a milestone in passing yards and contributing to a high-scoring game.

namedEntities.name: Cincinnati Bengals
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: NFL team based in Cincinnati, Ohio
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Bengals are the team that won the game, and their performance under Flacco's leadership demonstrates the importance of team resilience and veteran leadership in the NFL.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Steelers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: NFL team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Steelers were the opposing team, and their strong start and late-game challenges highlight the competitive nature of the game and the impact of veteran quarterback play.

namedEntities.name: Paycor Stadium
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Home stadium of the Cincinnati Bengals
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The venue adds context to the setting of the game, emphasizing the atmosphere and significance of the home advantage in a pivotal matchup.

namedEntities.name: Cameron Heyward
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Steelers defensive player and teammate of Aaron Rodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Heyward coined the nickname 'Icy Hot Bowl' for the game, highlighting the rivalry and intensity between the two veteran quarterbacks.

namedEntities.name: Joe Burrow
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former Bengals quarterback
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Burrow’s long-term injury created the need for Flacco to step in, showing how team depth and quarterback rotations are vital in the NFL.

namedEntities.name: Jake Browning
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Browning, a backup quarterback for the Bengals
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Browning’s prior performance and injury situation led to Flacco’s promotion, illustrating how player injuries influence team strategy and roster decisions.

namedEntities.name: Ja’Marr Chase
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Bengals wide receiver
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Chase had a standout game with 16 catches for 161 yards and a touchdown, showing the importance of wide receiver performance in high-pressure games.

namedEntities.name: Tee Higgins
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Bengals wide receiver
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Higgins had his season-high catch performance with six catches for 96 yards and a touchdown, contributing significantly to the Bengals' offensive output.

namedEntities.name: Noah Fant
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Bengals wide receiver
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fant caught a touchdown pass, adding to the Bengals’ three scoring plays from Flacco’s passes.

namedEntities.name: Pat Freiermuth
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Steelers tight end
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freiermuth caught a 68-yard touchdown pass from Rodgers, helping the Steelers maintain a one-point lead late in the game.

namedEntities.name: Jaylen Warren
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Steelers wide receiver
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Warren caught a 15-yard pass from Rodgers that helped Rodgers pass Ben Roethlisberger on the all-time passing yards list.

namedEntities.name: Evan McPherson
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Bengals kicker
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: McPherson converted a 36-yard field goal in the final minutes, giving the Bengals a two-point lead that secured the win.

namedEntities.name: Zac Taylor
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Head coach of the Cincinnati Bengals
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Taylor praised Flacco’s composure and leadership, emphasizing the team's resilience and offensive execution in key moments.

namedEntities.name: Ben Roethlisberger
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback and all-time passing leader
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rodgers passed Roethlisberger on the all-time career passing yards list, marking a historic milestone in NFL history.

namedEntities.name: Brett Favre
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former NFL quarterback, currently holds fourth place in career passing yards
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rodgers is still behind Favre in career passing yards, showing that the gap between the top performers remains significant.

namedEntities.name: Super Bowl XLVII
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Super Bowl championship won by Joe Flacco’s team
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Flacco’s Super Bowl victory is referenced to establish his legacy and credibility as a veteran quarterback.

namedEntities.name: AFC North
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Division in the NFL
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Steelers' standing in the AFC North highlights the competitive balance in the division and future matchups with Green Bay.

namedEntities.name: Green Bay Packers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: NFL team based in Green Bay, Wisconsin
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Packers are set to face the Steelers in Week 8, emphasizing future matchups and the ongoing rivalry among veteran quarterbacks.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a high-intensity Thursday Night Football matchup dubbed the 'Icy Hot Bowl' by Steelers teammate Cameron Heyward, 40-year-old Joe Flacco outperformed 41-year-old Aaron Rodgers in a dramatic 33-31 win over the Pittsburgh Steelers. Flacco, acquired to replace injured Joe Burrow and struggling Jake Browning, delivered a masterful performance with 342 yards and three touchdowns, including a crucial final drive that culminated in a winning field goal by Evan McPherson. The Bengals overcame a 10-0 second-quarter lead by Pittsburgh, who had Rodgers throw four touchdowns and pass Ben Roethlisberger to move into fifth place on the NFL’s all-time passing yards list. Despite the loss, Rodgers’ historic milestone and the resilience of both veterans underscore the continued relevance of elder statesmen in the NFL, proving that age and experience can still yield elite performances in the modern game.
title: Joe Flacco outduels Aaron Rodgers in battle of elder statesmen as Bengals stun Steelers in ‘Icy Hot Bowl’
